thread.title: MWC 2017: Nokia 6 coming to global markets including India
thread.title_full: MWC 2017: Nokia 6 coming to global markets including India

title: MWC 2017: Nokia 6 coming to global markets including India
text:
February 26, 2017 “The Nokia 6 is finally coming to a store near you in India” 
HMD Global, which owns the rights to manufacture and sell Nokia-branded phones, recently launched the Nokia 6 mid-range Android smartphone in China. Today at its pre-MWC event in Barcelona, the company has launched the Nokia 6 globally. The phone is priced at €239 (~Rs 16,000), and will be available globally in the second quarter of this year in Matte Black, Tempered Blue, Silver and Copper hues. There’s also a new special edition of the device in Arte Black colour, which has been priced at €299 (~Rs 21,000). 
The Nokia 6’s global variant will carry the same specs as its China variant. To recap, it flaunts an all-metal design, a 5.5-inch 1080p display with a layer of 2.5D Gorilla Glass 3, a Snapdragon 430 octa-core SoC, 4GB of RAM and 64GB of storage. The phone offers a 16MP rear camera, an 8MP front shooter, a 3,000mAh battery, 4G LTE, USB Type-C, Dolby ATMOS sound and Android Nougat.
